Summary * 15+years of experience in logic design including Processor, ASIC, RTL, System-On-Chip (SoC), and Configurable Designs. 
* Proven abilities in multiple aspects of logic design including micro-architecture definition, design, verification and debug, synthesis, post synthesis analysis, layout, and timing. 
* Deep understanding of many aspects of processor design such as processor pipelines, exception handling, simultaneous multi-threading, Cache Coherence, Inter Connects (Crossbar). 
* Delivered multiple building blocks and integrated multiple 3rd Party IP for both General Purpose as well as Custom (Network, Disk-Drive) embedded applications involving ARM and MIPS Processors. 
* Successfully drove architectural efforts on multiple projects. 
* Architected a number of complex processor chips on time and all on complex technologies. 
* Experienced in working on ASIC boards. 
* Highly motivated to learn new technologies and proven track record to deliver new assignments. 
* Proven ability to lead teams, act as a team player, and also work independently. 
 
Specialties: 
 
Microprocessor (Multi-core, Multi-thread), RTL, memory subsystem and SoC architecture and design.  
Languages: Verilog, System Verilog, C, Perl, C shell scripting, Assembly, Tcl/Tk. 
Tools: Debussy/Verdi, Design Compiler, VCS, Verilog XL, Jasper, Innologic, Synplicity, Quartus, Primetime.

Summary Design engineer working in the field of design and convergence for CPU core register files (RF) on the Broadwell project, and subsequently in RF IPs for Intel SOCs in the 14nm and 10nm process. Vertically experienced in the convergence of the silicon back-end full-custom design flow. 
 
Current focus include circuit study and SPICE simulation for RF circuits, as well as the owner of the strategic datamining charter, responsible for many convergence-level datamining strategies, scripting/coding, and enabling top level views on execution statuses, IP health and trends. Experience Engineer MediaTek February 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Singapore CPU Silicon Design Engineer Intel Corporation June 2009  –  January 2014  (4 years 8 months) Penang, Malaysia Worked in design and convergence of CPU core register files (RF) for Broadwell and subsequently RF IPs for SOCs in the 14nm and 10nm nodes.  
 
Experienced in the back-end full-custom design flow, which includes synthesis/netlister, FEV, RC extraction, static timing convergence, design quality/rulesets convergence, reliability (electromigration, self-heating effects, ageing) verification, signal integrity (SI) convergence, power (dynamic and leakage) reduction and optimisation techniques, floor planning, place and route, trunking and track planning, and PV/DFM convergence. 
 
Main focus and domain responsibilities include circuit study and SPICE simulation for RF circuits, definition of project limits (Vmin, slope and delay limits for list of standard cells, device aging studies, multiple-probable-point analysis/sigma analysis etc) and sizing requirements for various memory array topologies, as well as the owner of the strategic datamining charter, responsible for many convergence-level datamining strategies, scripting/coding, and enabling top level views on execution statuses, IP health and trends. NCADD eGT Trainee Intel Corporation January 2010  –  July 2011  (1 year 7 months) Penang, Malaysia Trainee of an advanced industrial training program in VLSI design, founded by Intel in collaboration with the Northern Corridor Initiative (NCADD NCIA), dubbed eGT. 
 
Trained in several technical areas from scripting (UNIX, Perl, Tk/Tcl, C++), front end silicon design practices (RTL, VHDL, Verilog, SystemVerilog, functional verification, FEV etc.) and gate level design (GLS, STA, CTS etc.), to circuit and layout design (RC Extraction, PnR, signal integrity, mask design, library design etc.) and fabrication (lithography, etching, yield analysis etc.). 
 
This training covered theories such as workflows, transistor physics, quantum behaviors, tool methodologies and algorithms, as well as practicals such as the Synopsys VCS, Altera Quartus, Opus, SPICE, and other undisclosed Intel internal tools. 
 
Designed a gate-level synthesizable RISC Multicore Microprocessor with a 4-stage pipeline, with branch prediction and out-of-order execution that uses a customized ISA sketched from MIPS but optimized for a smaller register file. 
 
Also involved in the re-architecture of a PCH legacy DMA unit. Intern Technical Intel Corporation May 2008  –  September 2008  (5 months) Penang, Malaysia Developed an understanding of pre-silicon validation in the area of gate level simulation (GLS).  
Involved in automation scripting (Unix/Perl) during the Ibexpeak (IBX) cycle.
